Constructor. Initialises both ADCs on the board.

Parameters
i2c_busThe string ID of the I2C bus.
A2D1_addrThe I2C address of the first ADC.
A2D1_addrThe I2C address of the second ADC.
debugDebug flag, passed to the ADC library.
channelThe I2C multiplexer which this unit is connected to.

Member Function Documentation

◆ get_channel()

uint8_t POL_OP::get_channel ( )

Get the I2C mux channel information for this polarisation opponent unit.

Note
This is referring to the sensor-level mux (i.e. the Adafruit one), not the ADC muxes.p
Returns
The I2C mux channel to which this pol op unit is connected.

◆ read_A2D()

bool POL_OP::read_A2D ( uint8_t  idx,
uint32_t *  readings,
uint8_t  delay = 100 
)

This function performs one complete read cycle of a specific ADC on the PCB.

Parameters
idxThe integer index of the ADC to be read (0 or 1).
readingsA pointer to an array large enough to store the output (of size > 2). The readings will be placed in this array.
delayA time delay (in ms) used to ensure data integrity.
Returns
True on success, false otherwise.
Warning
The current working status of this function is unknown.

◆ read_continuous()

uint32_t POL_OP::read_continuous ( SFE_ADS122C04  A2D,
uint8_t  delay = 100 
)
private

Read from the ADC if it is configured to continuous mode.

Note
You must make sure the ADC is in continuous mode before assuming this code will work. If initialised in POL_OP_MODE, this will be the case. Similarly, you must make sure the ADC channel is set prior to attempting a read to ensure sensible data.
Parameters
A2DThe ADC object from which we wish to read.
delayA time delay (in ms) to ensure data integrity.
Returns
The raw ADC reading.

Definition at line 136 of file POL_OP.cpp.

◆ read_raw_data()

uint32_t POL_OP::read_raw_data ( SFE_ADS122C04  A2D,
uint8_t  delay = 100 
)
private

Read raw data from a single ADC channel.

Note
In addition to the Adafruit I2C mux, each ADC also has its own multiplexer, on which two channels are in use (one for each photodiode). This function assumes the caller has already configured the ADC to read from the desired channel.
Warning
This function was used to read from the polarisation opponent units during early prototyping and its current working status is unknown.
The ADC readout uses a 16-bit encoding which requires sign extension which is not provided by this function!
Parameters
A2DThe ADC object we want to read from.
delayA time delay (in ms) used to ensure data integrity.
Returns
The raw 16 bit ADC data.

Definition at line 97 of file POL_OP.cpp.

◆ read_sensor()

bool POL_OP::read_sensor ( int *  readings,
uint8_t  delay = 100 
)

Performs a full (very slow) read from the PCB.

Note
The ADC encodes its output as a 16-bit signed integer which requres sign extension to be represented as a standard int. This function performs the required sign-extension.
Warning
The working status of this function is unknown. If it does work, it is guaranteed to be slow as it does not take advantage of the channel switching delays on the ADC.
Parameters
readingsA pointer to an array (size >= 4) which can hold all of the photodiode readings. The values will be placed in this array.
delayA time delay (in ms) to ensure data integrity.
Returns
true on success, false otherwise.

Definition at line 194 of file POL_OP.cpp.

◆ read_sensor_interleaved()

bool POL_OP::read_sensor_interleaved ( int *  readings,
uint8_t  delay = 100 
)

Perform a full interleaved read from the PCB.

This PCB read function takes advantage of the delays incurred in channel switching on the ADCs by performing one read, changing channel, then reading from the other ADC while we wait for the first one to finish changing channel.

Note
In the source there is a lot of code dedicated to time tracking. This is functionally irrelevant and was only used to characterise the sensor read latency. All print-outs should currently be disabled and can be re-enabled by uncommenting the print stream below.
Note
The default delay is 100ms but this can be set as low as 25ms. Any delay less than 25ms will start to cause read errors for the last polarisation opponent unit in the chain.
Parameters
readingsPointer to an array large enough to house all four photodiode readings as integers. The photodiode readings will be stored here.
delayTime delay (in ms) used to ensure data integrity.
Returns
true on success, false otherwise

Definition at line 248 of file POL_OP.cpp.

◆ set_data_rate()

bool POL_OP::set_data_rate ( uint8_t  rate)

Set data rate using presets defined in ADS122_ADC_PI.hpp; definitions included below for convenience:

#define ADS122C04_DATA_RATE_20SPS   0x0
#define ADS122C04_DATA_RATE_45SPS   0x1
#define ADS122C04_DATA_RATE_90SPS   0x2
#define ADS122C04_DATA_RATE_175SPS  0x3
#define ADS122C04_DATA_RATE_330SPS  0x4
#define ADS122C04_DATA_RATE_600SPS  0x5
#define ADS122C04_DATA_RATE_1000SPS 0x6

See the datasheet for the ADS112C04 for more information.

Parameters
Thedesired data rate.
Returns
true on success, false on failure.

Definition at line 372 of file POL_OP.cpp.

◆ set_gain()

bool POL_OP::set_gain ( uint8_t  gain)

Set the PGA gain for both ADCs on the PCB.

Note
The gain must be a valid 3-bit gain setting for the ADS122C04. Use relevant definitions in ADS122C04_ADC_PI.hpp (ADS122C04_GAIN_X) to ensure valid settings are used. No error checking is included!
Parameters
Thedesired 3-bit gain setting.
Returns
true on success, false on failure
